page.title: 10OPEN CAST MINING _ KNOWBURY
page.content: In 1984,{Open Cast Coal Mining}was carried out on a large sloping field belonging to a farm near Knowbury. The project would involve removing 20,000 tons of colliery spoil by lorry to a West Midland site. The Knowbury site would then be levelled and used for sheep grazing. The contractors said no lorries would go through the village, and they would be careful not to be a nuisance. When they started to remove top soil, people started to complain and protest. Knowbury Parish Councillors said they would do everything to prevent it. In 1985, the contractors had removed soil from a footpath, and they were given an order to appear before Ludlow Magistrates Court. In June 1985, no work was being carried out. The site looks barren. There are piles of coal and no turf.
